oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Brigadier General Simon Bolivar Buckner

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Military uniforms
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Buckner, Simon Bolivar, 1823-1914
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Half-length portrait of Confederate General Simon Bolivar Buckner in uniform. Visible are the brigadier general insignia and a sword resting in his lap.

Simon Bolivar Buckner of Kentucky served in the Mexican-American War and taught infantry tactics at West Point. During the Civil War he accepted a Confederate commission after Kentucky could no longer maintain neutrality. He served at Fort Donelson and in General Bragg's abortive invasion of Kentucky. Buckner saw action at Perryville, Chickamauga, and Chattanooga. In 1887 he successfully ran for Governor of Kentucky. In 1896 he ran unsuccessfully for president on the National Democratic Party ticket.
